title: "ADC Mains Are Never Happy With the Meta!"
body:
Fact: The reason why ADC mains are never happy with the meta is because the meta is always determined by and based on the most effective way to counter the adc role at any given time. This is because the adc is viable in all meta because of its function in terms of objective control and sustained damage. So the meta always evolves based on the best current way to kill/neutralize the enemy ADC. Thus it never really feels fun to them because they are always the target.

Blame the game design because what I just said is the absolute truth. Its hard to be happy when the game more or less depends on you being able to do your job and you are the number one target every game all game. Meanwhile if you die early the team rages and reports you. ALL while the enemy is typically playing the style/champs that most effectively kill you.

Edit:  I am happy to see such a conversation about this topic that hasn't devolved into a bunch of finger pointing.  I think we are all in agreement that the ADC plays such a vital role in the game that it really does shape the way everyone else plays the game.  Keep it going and keep it friendly!

This is true.  But is still serves to show my point.  If there were not a support in botlane, enemy teams would just send some solo lane monster that would shot down the ADC in lane 1v1 because that would be the best way to counter them.  New meta.

check out the pro game where Twitch was solo top against Renekton (I believe) and won lane, won game. ADCs are actually some of the stronger laners, what with Draven being tankier than Riven, ranged and higher damage than Riven and all. Pretty much any ADC with LCS mechanics can beat any melee top with LCS mechanics. It is only due to the limitations of low elo people with no teamwork that ADCs need a support at all.

there is no sololane monster that can reliable shut down an ADC 1v1. They have actually the strongest laning-phase in the game (just look at some progames with laneswaps...they are totally happy having even a twitch or kog laning 1v1 vs a "normal" toplaner).

Now now, that's not true. Another ADC can shut down an ADC 1v1. ADCs are solo lane monsters. Ergo there is in fact a solo lane monster that can reliably shut down an ADC 1v1. See? It works perfectly! I don't know why we don't all just play games with 5 ADCs on each side.
During Nemesis Draft the easiest way to win was to give the enemy team 5 ADCs.
Because then people like {{champion:11}} would get 1v5 pentakills without even trying.

And then the normal toplaner hits level 6 and jumps onto the ADC and destroys them.

At one point it was meta for ADC's to go solo lanes because they gave tanks a hard time early game. Because of that, the meta shifted to more assassins playing in lane instead of jungle, and the tanks going jungle instead. Once an assassin hit's level 6, the solo lane is over for that ADC.

Playing ADC means 80% of the team's damage output comes from you. It's a **lot** of pressure.

During laning phase you have 2 people in your lane (3 if you count the jungler) who passionately hate you and will do everything in their power to eviscerate you the moment they get the chance. And if you lose out early game, they will take every opportunity to get to you, kick your face into the ground, and repeatedly rip you apart with the finest demonstrations of overkill, despite you being absolutely no threat to them.

During mid game, you have fighters/assassins hunting you down hoping to catch you without your support, tanks trying to toss you into the enemy team, and mages trying to exploit the slightest slip up in your positioning to insta-gib you.

Late game, the team fights are almost entirely dependent on your performance. If you miss an opportunity to safely land some basic attacks, you might never get it again, and possibly could get blown up instead and cost your team the game.

Frankly I don't understand why anyone volunteers for this role. I have played games as ADC (last pick) and had awesome supports that put in work to get me fed and let me actually carry, but I still hate playing ADC.

You're seeing one side of the coin. The meta isn't just based on killing the ADC most effectively, it's based on killing the enemy ADC most effectively while also giving your team's ADC the highest chance of success. Why do you think everyone is talking about Jinx right now? Because the tanky meta means her teammates excel at peeling for ADCs that need peel right now. You get focused and hunted a lot? Sure, but you also have an ally on your team who is explicitly playing to keep you alive and set up kills for you, every other role (except assassins because they're designed to be selfish) will put you first because they realise you're more important AND at the end of a winning game, you're the one who's wrecked all the towers and probably got the highest amount of kills by far. 

ADCs get all the negative stuff because they are the single most important part of their team, but being that important comes with good stuff too. The meta is based around the best way to shut down the enemy ADC but you're a fool if you think the current meta isn't also built to set up your team's ADC too. And at the end of the day you get highs no other role gets, so it is only fair that you get more lows too. Imagine if the support drew as much focus as the ADC despite getting a fraction of the glory? Nobody would ever play the role again.

I agree entirely; when I play ADC I've mentioned numerous times to various friends that I hate feeling like I'm not even a player, but rather a walking objective.

ADCs generally have very little capacity to make #LCSbigplays because their role constrains their kits. Quinn is awful as a marksman because her kit allows her to do other things, so her sustained damage has to be lower than other marksmen. Kog'maw is perhaps the strongest straight-up "right click to win" champion in the game, and he has NOTHING in his kit that he can use to outplay his opponent, only his R to desperately try to secure a kill.
There's a reason most ADCs are interchangeable, and people just overall play whichever ADC is currently favored the most by *what other people are playing in other roles*: They're not really capable of effecting much change in a game, and their one job is to not die. That's it. Don't die. It's not "isolate X target" or "CC this guy" or "disrupt the enemy team" or "effectively take objectives solo" etc etc. it's "Don't die, because as long as your team keeps you alive you will win fights by sheer force of existing." ADCs can't do anything by themselves, and if they CAN because they're so monstrously fed, they STILL are most effective just following their teammates around and outputting damage.


I've kinda stopped playing ADC much lately even though it's perhaps my best role, because it's so dull having no real impact on the game. Having the strongest attacks doesn't give you game impact, it just turns you into a mobile artillery unit that your teammates move around the map like a chess piece.
